title: This activity teaches you to how to use user defined exceptions in any java program.

questionText.text:
Now your task is to extend the program which is discussed as part of the video.
ListEmptyException:This exception has to be thrown when there is no element to be removed from the list, Throw this exception and print message saying List is empty
Check your program against test cases below as a zip file. Submit your solution(zip file) when all test cases are passed

title: This assignment tests you to how to define create and use user-defined exceptions

questionText.text:
Use the program which is developed in the List ADT (Abstract Data Types) unit and create the user-defined exceptions as follows
a) subList(int, int) :Returns a list containing elements, including startIndex and excluding endIndex. The first parameter indicates the startIndex and the second parameter indicates the endIndex.
b) equals(int[]) : Returns a boolean indicating whether the parameter int[] exactly matches with the given list or not
c) ListEmptyException: This exception has to be thrown when there is no element to be removed from the list, Throw this exception and print message saying List is empty.
Check your program against test cases below as a zip file. Submit your solution(zip file) when all test cases are passed
